source: Data for this view come from TAIR10 assembly.
Data for this view comes from NCBI Gene2Pubmed. Data for Gene RIFs comes from NCBI Gene RIFs
Data for this view comes from TAIR GFF3, TAIR Protein Sequences, TAIR Gene Aliases, TAIR Functional description and TAIR10 Genome Sequence.

Data for this view come from the BAR Arabidopsis Interactions viewer database (introduced in Geisler-Lee et al., 2007 and last updated November 15th, 2018).

The Interactions viewer displays protein interactors for the currently selected gene product from our database of ~80k predicted and ~100k confirmed protein interactions, and 2.8M protein-DNA interactions. The predicted interactions (interologs) were generated by Drs Matt Geisler and Jane Geisler-Lee at the Southern Illinois University. Their current version is Interactome 2.0. The confirmed Arabidopsis interacting proteins come from BIND, the Biomolecular Interaction Network Database, from high-density Arabidopsis protein microarrays (Popescu et al., 2007; Popescu et al., 2009), from Braun et al.'s Arabidopsis Interactome 2011, from Wolf Frommer's Membrane protein INteractome Database MIND, and over 1190 other literature sources, including 42,605 interactions from BioGRID (Nov. 2018). The interactions in BIND and from other literature sources were identified using several different methods, such as yeast two hybrid screens, but also via traditional biochemical methods. Protein-DNA interactions come from these experimentally-determined sources: 1,784 Y1H PDIs come from Taylor-Teeples et al. (2015) Nature 517:571-575, and 2.7 million DAP-seq PDIs come from O'Malley et al. (2016) Cell 165: 1280-1292.. Protein-DNA interactions also come from the FIMO prediction program (Grant et al., 2011, Bioinformatics, 27(7):1017-1018. Use the links to BIND/MIND/AI/PubMed records that are in the output of this viewer to view further information. All subcellular localisation data is from SUBA4, the Arabidopsis Subcellular Database (Hopper et al., 2017, Nucleic Acids Research 45(D1):D1064-D1074 doi: 10.1093/nar/gkw1041 ). These localisations do not include predicted localisations.
notes: This viewer was built with CytoscapeJS.

source: The data come from Weigel Lab (Lempe et al., 2005, PLOS Genetics 1:e6)
notes:
Aerial parts of 4 day old seedlings greenhouse-grown in soil at 23C under continuous light were sampled. Data normalized by GCOS method, TGT value of 100. Note that plants were grown together in a single growth chamber and are depicted here according to their collection location for visualization purposes only.

Historical climate data comes from: Jones, P. D., and I. Harris, 2013: CRU TS3.21: Climatic Research Unit (CRU) Time Series (TS) Version 3.21 of High Resolution Gridded Data of Month‐by‐month Variation of Climate (Jan. 1901‐Dec. 2012). 3.21 ed., U. o. E. Anglia, Ed., NCAS British Atmospheric Data Centre.

Climate data map tiles come from: http://sdwebx.worldbank.org/climateportal/

source: The data come from Schmid et al., 2005, Nature Genetics 37:501 and Nakabayashi et al., 2005, The Plant Journal, Vol 41:697. Gene expression data generated by the Affymetrix ATH1 array are normalalized by the GCOS method, TGT value of 100. Most tissues were sampled in triplicate.
notes: Data are normalalized by the GCOS method, TGT value of 100. Most tissues were sampled in triplicate.

source: The data come from Hooper CM, Castleden I, Tanz SK, Aryamanesh, and Millar, AH (2017) SUBA4: the interactive data analysis centre for Arabidopsis subcellular protein locations Nucleic Acids Res. Jan 4;45(D1):D1064-D1074. doi: 10.1093/nar/gkw1041
notes:
The SUBA4 database contains information on the computationally predicted and experimentally documented subcellular localization of many Arabidopsis proteins. We apply the formula indicated in the Material and Methods section of Winter et al. 2007 (doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0000718) to generate a confidence score for each distinct subcellular compartment or region, with experimentally-determined localizations being weighted five times more than predicted ones. The higher the confidence score for a given subcellular compartment, the more intense the red colour in the Cell eFP Browser output.

See further details at SUBA4: http://suba.live/suba-app/factsheet.html?id={GENEID}

source:
The 3D molecule data come from Phyre2: Kelley LA et al. Nature Protocols 10, 845-858 (2015).

SNP data come from The 1001 Genomes Consortium (2016) 1135 genomes reveal the global pattern of polymorphism in Arabidopsis thaliana Cell, Volume 166, Issue 2, 481-491 and the Polymorph API at https://tools.1001genomes.org/polymorph/

Pfam domain data come from Finn et al., (2014). CDD feature hits come from Marchler-Bauer et al., (2015).
notes: This viewer was built with JSmol.

source: This is an implementation of JBrowse using data provided by Araport11, EPIC-CoGe epigenomics data, and more (Krishnakumar et al., 2014, Nucleic Acids Research, DOI: 10.1093/nar/gku1200)

* Microgametogenesis: Honeys & Twell, 2004, Genome Biology 5:R85

* Pollen Germination: Quin et al., 2009, PLOS Genetics 5:e1000621
* Shoot Apical Meristem: Yadav et al., 2009, Procedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA, 106:4941
* Trichomes: Marks et al., 2009, Molecular Plant 2:803; Gilding & Marks, 2010, The Plant Journal, 64:304
* Root: Birnbaum et al., 2003, Science 302:1956; Nawy et al., 2005, Plant Cell 17:1908
* Hormone and Chemical: Goda et al., 2008, The Plant Journal, 55:526
* Guard Cell Mutant and Wild Type Guard Cell ABA Response: Pandey et al., 2010, Molecular Systems Biology 6:372

* Abiotic Stress: Kilian et al., 2007, The Plant Journal, 50:347
* Xylem & Cork: Malcolm Campbell lab (unpublished)
* Subcellular Localization: Tanz et al., 2013, Nucleic Acids Research 41:D1185-91.
